thread.title: S Aravind replaces Umesh Yadav in India ODI squad; Injured Ashwin not picked
thread.title_full: S Aravind replaces Umesh Yadav in India ODI squad; Injured Ashwin not picked

title: S Aravind replaces Umesh Yadav in India ODI squad; Injured Ashwin not picked
text:
Updated: Monday, October 19, 2015, 17:55 [IST] Facebook Twitter Google+ Comments Mail 
New Delhi, Oct 19: Left-arm paceman Sreenath Aravind was today called into the Indian ODI squad for the remaining 2 matches against South Africa. He has replaced Umesh Yadav in the 15-man squad. R Ashwin , who is injured, has been left out. 
Also read: Who is Aravind? 
Aravind made his international debut earlier this month against South Africa in the 1st T20I in Dharamsala. However, he was ignored for the next 2 games and was not part of the ongoing ODI series in the first 3 matches. The selectors picked the squad today in Delhi. S Aravind 
The 31-year-old Karnataka bowler took 4 wickets on Saturday (October 17) to help his team take the first innings lead against Vidarbha in the Ranji Trophy. 
Umesh, who played in 1st 2 ODIs and dropped for the 3rd against South Africa, was expensive. He took 3 wickets conceding 123 runs in 18 overs at an economy rate of 6.83. 
Ashwin, who sustained a side strain during the 1st ODI, is the other man to miss out. However, he was today (October 19) named in the Test squad to face the Proteas. He has more than 2 weeks to recover from the injury as the first Test starts in Mohali on November 5. 
South Africa lead the 5-match series 2-1. The visitors won the opener and 3rd game in Kanpur and Rajkot respectively. India tasted success in Indore. The 4th ODI is on Thursday (October 22) in Chennai. 
India ODI squad 
Mahendra Singh Dhoni (captain and wicketkeeper), Stuart Binny, Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Axar Patel, Ajinkya Rahane, Suresh Raina, Ambati Rayudu, Mohit Sharma, Rohit Sharma, Sreenath Aravind, Gurkeerat Singh, Amit Mishra and Harbhajan Singh. 
In: Sreenath Aravind 
Out: R Ashwin (injured), Umesh Yadav 
Remaining matches in Ind-SA ODI series 
4th ODI in Chennai on October 22 (Thursday) 
5th and final ODI in Mumbai on October 25 (Sunday) 
OneIndia News
